title: Jospong Group CEO Advocates Industrialization
text:
8 September 2015 13:51 CET Jospong Group CEO Advocates Industrialization By Daily Guide 
Ami Mehl (fourth left) Dr. Joseph Siaw Agyepong (fifth left) in a pose with management of Zoomlion 
The Executive Chairman of Jospong Group of Companies, Dr. Joseph Siaw Agyepong, says Ghana must vigorously pursue programmes and policies to deepen industrialization in the country in order to salvage the economy. 
He said industrialization would help reduce about 60 percent of imports to ensure a robust and resilient economy. 
Dr. Agyepong, who was interacting with the Israeli Ambassador to Ghana after he paid a familiarization visit to some subsidiaries of Jospong Group, said industrialization holds the key to Ghana’s development. 
The Executive Chairman called for the transfer of technology to help build an industrialized economy. 
When you industrialize, you create jobs and control your own money, a country that does not go into industrialization and imports almost everything always goes into recession,' he explained. 
'With industrialization, we can cut off 60-70 percent of our imports and that is why we are venturing into the manufacture of all sorts of products,' Dr Agyepong intimated. 
He praised Israel for passionately developing technology and expressed optimism that bilateral relations would deepen to ensure transfer of technology. 
The Israeli Ambassador to Ghana Ami Mehl visited the Vehicle Assembling Plant, Zoompak Waste Transfer Station at Teshie, Yeeco Plastics Ghana Limited in Tema, Universal Plastic Products and Recycling Limited, JA Plant Pool Ghana Limited, Mudor Decal Treatment Plant, which is still under construction and the lavender hill, among others. 
Mr Mehl commended management and staff of Zoomlion and Jospong Group for making positive contributions to the development of Ghana. 
The envoy lauded the company’s passion for industrialization, recycling and waste management and mentioned that Israel currently has a lot of technologies that can be transferred to other countries. 
He stressed the importance of industrialization and agriculture, saying the two sectors can expedite any country’s development. 
Mr Mehl reiterated Israel's desire to partner organizations such as Zoomlion for further growth. 
'Ghana needs partnership and cooperation and not support; we are therefore happy to be here and when we find the right partners, we will share our technologies,' he said. 
By Melvin Tarlue
